title: Lyft to add autonomous shuttles in 2026 as Uber inks more self-driving deals
description: It's one of just a few similar partnerships Lyft has struck, while rival Uber has an increasingly long list of robotaxi deals.

title: Tesla is reportedly bringing a limited version of its robotaxi service to San Francisco
description: There will be an employee in the driver's seat -- a big change from how things have been working in Austin.

title: Apple broadens App Store’s age rating system
description: Apple has expanded its age rating system to include 13+, 16+, and 18+ ratings, in addition to the existing ratings for younger users.

title: Tesla is reportedly behind on its pledge to build 5,000 Optimus bots this year
description: Tesla is behind on its goal to produce at least 5,000 Optimus humanoid robots by the end of 2025.

title: Meta to stop selling political ads in the EU from October
description: In response to the European Union's incoming regulation of political advertising, Meta said on Friday that it would stop selling and showing political ads in the EU from October 2025.

title: Google is testing a vibe-coding app called Opal
description: Google is testing a new vibe-coding tool called Opal, available in the U.S. through Google Labs, that lets users quickly spin up web apps with just a few prompts.

title: Amid increased momentum for defense, the NATO Innovation Fund refreshes its investment team
description: The NATO Innovation Fund (NIF) is entering a new chapter, marked by the arrival of two new partners and the departure of its penultimate founding team partner.

title: How a Y Combinator food-delivery app used TikTok to soar in the App Store
description: BiteSight is a food-delivery app that lets users watch videos of food before ordering. It also lets customers see what their friends have ordered and bookmark places to try out.

title: VC Victor Lazarte is leaving Benchmark to launch his own firm
description: Lazarte has only been at Benchmark for two years. He backed startups like Mercor, HeyGen, and Decart AI.

title: Intel continues to pull back on its manufacturing projects
description: Intel canceled multiple manufacturing projects in Europe and delayed its Ohio chip plant for the second time this year.

title: X to test using Community Notes to find the posts everyone likes
description: X is piloting a new feature that will help to identify the platform's best posts. The system is similar to how Community Notes fact-checking works.

title: Chime backer Lauren Kolodny bets on AI to revolutionize estate processing
description: Acrew Capital's Kolodny led a $20 million Series A in Alix, a startup that uses AI to automate estate processing.

title: This industrial AI startup is winning over customers by saying it won’t get acquired
description: In a red-hot acquisition market, the CVector founders answer this key question in its first conversation with prospective customers.

title: Apple iOS 26 public beta arrives
description: Apple released iOS 26 in public beta. Here's everything you can expect, from the Liquid Glass design to features powered by Apple Intelligence.

title: Google’s new Web Guide search experiment organizes results with AI
description: Google's new Search Labs experiment will organize the search results using AI smarts.

title: Spotify takes a swing at gaming with a mini golf game ahead of ‘Happy Gilmore 2’ release
description: Netflix and Spotify teamed up to launch a golf-inspired game as a way to promote “Happy Gilmore 2,”  which premieres on Netflix this Friday.

title: The First Planned Migration of an Entire Country Is Underway

title: A Premium Luggage Service’s Web Bugs Exposed the Travel Plans of Every User—Including Diplomats
description: Security flaws in Airportr, a door-to-door luggage checking service used by 10 airlines, let hackers access user data and even gain privileges that would have let them redirect or steal luggage.

title: An Inventor Is Injecting Bleach Into Cancerous Tumors—and Wants to Bring the Treatment to the US
description: A Chinese man with no medical training is injecting cancer patients with a toxic bleach solution; a full course of treatment runs $20,000. He’s now working to bring the unproven treatment to the US.
